# PRD Test Cases

**Legend**
1. ID format: `<RESOURCE>-<CATEGORY>-<ROUTE/OP>-###` (example: `TASK-VAL-POST-014`).
2. Error types and status codes: `400 VALIDATION_ERROR`, `401 UNAUTHENTICATED_ERROR`, `403 UNAUTHORIZED_ERROR`, `404 NOT_FOUND_ERROR`, `409 CONFLICT_ERROR`, `429 RATE_LIMITED_ERROR`, `500 INTERNAL_ERROR`.
3. Shared test data assumptions: a seeded Platform Organization with `isPlatformOrg=true`, a Customer Organization with `isPlatformOrg=false`, at least one ACTIVE and one INACTIVE Department per org, ACTIVE and INACTIVE users for each role, soft-deleted records for each resource, and ownership setup for `createdBy`, `assignees`, `watchers`, `uploadedBy`, and `mentions`.
4. Scope vocabulary: `self`, `ownOrg`, `crossOrg`, `ownOrg.ownDept`, `ownOrg.crossDept`, `any`.
5. Ownership vocabulary: `self`, `createdBy`, `uploadedBy`, `assignees`, `watchers`, `mentioned`, `manager`, `isHod`.
6. Formatting note: no nested bullets are used anywhere; headings plus numbered lists only.

## Authentication and Session (Auth Routes + Socket)

**Auth - Validation**
1. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-001: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects missing `organization` object with 400 VALIDATION_ERROR. Invalid example: `null`.
2. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-002: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects missing `organization.name`. Invalid example: `null`.
3. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-003: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects `organization.name` length < 2 or > 100. Invalid example: `"A"`.
4. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-004: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects `organization.name` not matching `/^[a-zA-Z0-9\s\-&.,'()]+$/`. Invalid example: `"@@@"`.
5. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-005: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects missing `organization.email` or invalid email format or email length > 100. Invalid example: `null`.
6. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-006: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects missing `organization.phone` or phone not matching `^(\+251\d{9}|09\d{8})$`. Invalid example: `null`.
7. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-007: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects `organization.address` length < 5 or > 500. Invalid example: `""`.
8. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-008: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects missing `organization.industry` or invalid enum value. Invalid example: `null`.
9. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-009: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects missing `organization.size` or invalid enum value. Invalid example: `null`.
10. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-010: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects `organization.description` length > 1000. Invalid example: `"x" * 101`.
11. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-011: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects missing `department` object. Invalid example: `null`.
12. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-012: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects missing `department.name` or invalid pattern or length outside 2-100. Invalid example: `null`.
13. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-013: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects missing `department.description` or length > 500. Invalid example: `null`.
14. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-014: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects missing `user` object. Invalid example: `null`.
15. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-015: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects missing `user.firstName` or invalid pattern or length outside 2-50. Invalid example: `null`.
16. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-016: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects missing `user.lastName` or invalid pattern or length outside 2-50. Invalid example: `null`.
17. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-017: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects missing `user.position` or invalid pattern or length outside 2-100. Invalid example: `null`.
18. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-018: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects missing `user.email` or invalid email format or length > 100. Invalid example: `null`.
19. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-019: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects missing `user.password` or length outside 8-128. Invalid example: `null`.
20. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-020: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects missing `user.confirmPassword` or mismatch with `password`. Invalid example: `null`.
21. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-021: `POST /api/auth/register` ignores or rejects any `termsAccepted` field (CAN-007). Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
22. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-022: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects duplicate organization email with 409 CONFLICT_ERROR. Invalid example: `"existing@example.com"`.
23. AUTH-VAL-REGISTER-023: `POST /api/auth/register` rejects duplicate user email with 409 CONFLICT_ERROR. Invalid example: `"existing@example.com"`.
24. AUTH-VAL-VERIFY-001: `POST /api/auth/verify-email` rejects missing `token`. Invalid example: `null`.
25. AUTH-VAL-VERIFY-002: `POST /api/auth/verify-email` rejects invalid or expired `token`. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
26. AUTH-VAL-RESEND-001: `POST /api/auth/resend-verification` rejects missing `email`. Invalid example: `null`.
27. AUTH-VAL-RESEND-002: `POST /api/auth/resend-verification` rejects invalid email format. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
28. AUTH-VAL-LOGIN-001: `POST /api/auth/login` rejects missing `email` or invalid email format. Invalid example: `null`.
29. AUTH-VAL-LOGIN-002: `POST /api/auth/login` rejects missing `password`. Invalid example: `null`.
30. AUTH-VAL-REFRESH-001: `POST /api/auth/refresh` rejects missing refresh token cookie. Invalid example: `null`.
31. AUTH-VAL-FORGOT-001: `POST /api/auth/forgot-password` rejects missing `email` or invalid email format. Invalid example: `null`.
32. AUTH-VAL-RESET-001: `POST /api/auth/reset-password` rejects missing `token`. Invalid example: `null`.
33. AUTH-VAL-RESET-002: `POST /api/auth/reset-password` rejects missing `password` or length outside 8-128. Invalid example: `null`.
34. AUTH-VAL-RESET-003: `POST /api/auth/reset-password` rejects missing `confirmPassword` or mismatch. Invalid example: `null`.
35. AUTH-VAL-CHANGE-001: `POST /api/auth/change-password` rejects missing `currentPassword`. Invalid example: `null`.

37. AUTH-VAL-CHANGE-003: `POST /api/auth/change-password` rejects missing `confirmNewPassword` or mismatch. Invalid example: `null`.

**Auth - Authorization**
1. AUTH-AUTHZ-CHANGE-001: `POST /api/auth/change-password` requires valid access token; unauthenticated requests return 401.
2. AUTH-AUTHZ-CHANGE-002: `POST /api/auth/change-password` denies tokens for users with `status=INACTIVE` with 403.
3. AUTH-AUTHZ-LOGOUT-001: `POST /api/auth/logout` requires valid refresh token cookie; missing or invalid cookie returns 401.
4. AUTH-AUTHZ-REFRESH-001: `POST /api/auth/refresh` requires valid refresh token cookie; invalid or expired returns 401.

**Auth - Controller**
1. AUTH-CTRL-REGISTER-001: `POST /api/auth/register` creates Organization, Department, and initial SuperAdmin user in an unverified state; no auth cookies are set.
2. AUTH-CTRL-REGISTER-002: `POST /api/auth/register` sets `Organization.isVerified=false` and `User.isVerified=false` for initial onboarding.
3. AUTH-CTRL-REGISTER-003: `POST /api/auth/register` sends verification email to the initial user.
4. AUTH-CTRL-VERIFY-001: `POST /api/auth/verify-email` sets `Organization.isVerified=true` and `verifiedAt` and sets `User.isVerified=true` and `emailVerifiedAt`.
5. AUTH-CTRL-VERIFY-002: `POST /api/auth/verify-email` clears verification token fields and sends welcome email exactly once.
6. AUTH-CTRL-RESEND-001: `POST /api/auth/resend-verification` returns 429 when rate limited.
7. AUTH-CTRL-LOGIN-001: `POST /api/auth/login` rejects initial onboarding user when `isVerified=false` with 403.
8. AUTH-CTRL-LOGIN-002: `POST /api/auth/login` rejects `status=INACTIVE` with 403.
9. AUTH-CTRL-LOGIN-003: `POST /api/auth/login` sets HttpOnly access and refresh cookies and returns the user summary payload.
10. AUTH-CTRL-LOGIN-004: `POST /api/auth/login` JWT payload includes role, organization, and department identifiers.
11. AUTH-CTRL-REFRESH-001: `POST /api/auth/refresh` rotates refresh token and issues new access token.
12. AUTH-CTRL-REFRESH-002: `POST /api/auth/refresh` rejects invalid refresh token without altering existing cookies.
13. AUTH-CTRL-LOGOUT-001: `POST /api/auth/logout` clears auth cookies and returns success.
14. AUTH-CTRL-FORGOT-001: `POST /api/auth/forgot-password` returns generic success message even for non-existent email.
15. AUTH-CTRL-RESET-001: `POST /api/auth/reset-password` updates password, clears reset token fields, and invalidates previous reset tokens.
16. AUTH-CTRL-CHANGE-001: `POST /api/auth/change-password` validates current password and updates stored hash.

**Auth - Socket Authentication**
1. AUTH-SOCK-001: Socket connection without token is rejected with authentication error.
2. AUTH-SOCK-002: Socket connection with invalid token signature is rejected.
3. AUTH-SOCK-003: Socket connection with expired access token is rejected.
4. AUTH-SOCK-004: Socket connection for `status=INACTIVE` user is rejected with 403 UNAUTHORIZED_ERROR.
5. AUTH-SOCK-005: Socket connection for unverified onboarding user is rejected until verification succeeds.
6. AUTH-SOCK-006: Socket authentication uses the same JWT secret and payload as HTTP.
7. AUTH-SOCK-007: On successful socket connect, user joins `user:{userId}`, `org:{orgId}`, and `dept:{deptId}` rooms.

## Organization

**Organization - Authentication**
1. ORG-AUTH-GETLIST-001: `GET /api/organizations` (if implemented) without token returns 401.
2. ORG-AUTH-GETONE-001: `GET /api/organizations/:organizationId` (if implemented) without token returns 401.
3. ORG-AUTH-PUT-001: `PUT /api/organizations/:organizationId` (if implemented) without token returns 401.
4. ORG-AUTH-DELETE-001: `DELETE /api/organizations/:organizationId` (if implemented) without token returns 401.
5. ORG-AUTH-RESTORE-001: `PATCH /api/organizations/:organizationId/restore` (if implemented) without token returns 401.
6. ORG-AUTH-GETONE-002: `GET /api/organizations/:organizationId` (if implemented) with expired token returns 401.
7. ORG-AUTH-GETONE-003: `GET /api/organizations/:organizationId` (if implemented) with `status=INACTIVE` user returns 403.
8. ORG-AUTH-GETONE-004: `GET /api/organizations/:organizationId` (if implemented) with cross-org token misuse returns 403 or 400 per matrix.

**Organization - Validation**
1. ORG-VAL-UPDATE-001: Organization `name` required, length 2-100, pattern `/^[a-zA-Z0-9\s\-&.,'()]+$/`. Invalid example: `"@@@"`.
2. ORG-VAL-UPDATE-002: Organization `email` required, valid format, length <= 100, unique across organizations. Invalid example: `""`.
3. ORG-VAL-UPDATE-003: Organization `phone` required, matches `^(\+251\d{9}|09\d{8})$`. Invalid example: `"12345"`.
4. ORG-VAL-UPDATE-004: Organization `address` required, length 5-500. Invalid example: `""`.
5. ORG-VAL-UPDATE-005: Organization `industry` required, enum value only. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
6. ORG-VAL-UPDATE-006: Organization `size` required, enum value only. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
7. ORG-VAL-UPDATE-007: Organization `description` optional, max 1000. Invalid example: `"x" * 1001`.
8. ORG-VAL-UPDATE-008: Organization `logo.url` optional, must match Cloudinary URL pattern. Invalid example: `"https://example.com/file.jpg"`.
9. ORG-VAL-UPDATE-009: Organization `logo.publicId` optional, max 255. Invalid example: `"x" * 256`.
10. ORG-VAL-UPDATE-010: Organization `isVerified` must be boolean when provided. Invalid example: `"yes"`.
11. ORG-VAL-UPDATE-011: Organization `verifiedAt` must be a valid Date if provided. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
12. ORG-VAL-UPDATE-012: Organization update rejects invalid `organizationId` param or non-existent org. Invalid example: `"507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"`.
13. ORG-VAL-LIST-001: `GET /api/organizations` (if implemented) validates list params: `page`, `limit`, `sortBy`, `sortOrder`, `search`, `includeDeleted`. Invalid example: `page=0, sortOrder="up"`.

**Organization - Authorization**
1. ORG-AUTHZ-READ-001: Platform SuperAdmin with `isPlatformOrgUser=true` can read any organization (scope any).
2. ORG-AUTHZ-READ-002: All roles can read their own organization (scope ownOrg).
3. ORG-AUTHZ-READ-003: Non-platform users cannot read cross-org organizations.
4. ORG-AUTHZ-READ-004: Admin, Manager, and User are denied when attempting to read any cross-org organization.
5. ORG-AUTHZ-UPDATE-001: Platform SuperAdmin can update organizations in other orgs (scope crossOrg).
6. ORG-AUTHZ-UPDATE-002: Platform SuperAdmin can update their own platform organization (scope ownOrg).
7. ORG-AUTHZ-UPDATE-003: Non-platform SuperAdmin can update their own organization.
8. ORG-AUTHZ-UPDATE-004: Admin, Manager, User cannot update organizations.
9. ORG-AUTHZ-UPDATE-005: Non-platform SuperAdmin is denied when updating a cross-org organization.
10. ORG-AUTHZ-DELETE-001: Platform SuperAdmin can delete organizations in other orgs (scope crossOrg).
11. ORG-AUTHZ-DELETE-002: No role can delete the platform organization.
12. ORG-AUTHZ-DELETE-003: Non-platform SuperAdmin, Admin, Manager, and User are denied when deleting any organization.
13. ORG-AUTHZ-RESTORE-001: Restore (if implemented) follows delete permissions and denies other roles.

**Organization - Controller**
1. ORG-CTRL-VERIFY-001: `verify-email` sets `Organization.isVerified=true` and sets `verifiedAt` only once.
2. ORG-CTRL-UPDATE-001: Organization updates use `req.validated` only and run in a session transaction.
3. ORG-CTRL-DELETE-001: Organization delete uses soft delete only and cascades per PRD.
4. ORG-CTRL-DELETE-002: Attempting to delete platform organization is blocked with 403 or 409.
5. ORG-CTRL-RESTORE-001: Restore uses `.withDeleted()` checks and restores cascaded resources in correct order.
6. ORG-CTRL-TENANT-001: Non-platform users cannot access or mutate other organizations even if IDs are valid.

## Department

**Department - Authentication**
1. DEPT-AUTH-GETLIST-001: `GET /api/departments` without token returns 401.
2. DEPT-AUTH-GETONE-001: `GET /api/departments/:departmentId` without token returns 401.
3. DEPT-AUTH-GETACT-001: `GET /api/departments/:departmentId/activity` without token returns 401.
4. DEPT-AUTH-POST-001: `POST /api/departments` without token returns 401.
5. DEPT-AUTH-PUT-001: `PUT /api/departments/:departmentId` without token returns 401.
6. DEPT-AUTH-DELETE-001: `DELETE /api/departments/:departmentId` without token returns 401.
7. DEPT-AUTH-RESTORE-001: `PATCH /api/departments/:departmentId/restore` without token returns 401.
8. DEPT-AUTH-GETONE-002: Expired or invalid token returns 401.
9. DEPT-AUTH-GETONE-003: `status=INACTIVE` user returns 403.
10. DEPT-AUTH-GETONE-004: Cross-org token misuse returns 403 or 400.

**Department - Validation**
1. DEPT-VAL-CREATE-001: `name` required, length 2-100, pattern `/^[a-zA-Z0-9\s\-&.,'()]+$/`. Invalid example: `"@@@"`.
2. DEPT-VAL-CREATE-002: `description` required, length <= 500. Invalid example: `""`.
3. DEPT-VAL-CREATE-003: `status` enum `ACTIVE|INACTIVE`, default `ACTIVE`. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
4. DEPT-VAL-CREATE-004: `managerId` optional, must exist in same organization. Invalid example: `"507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"`.
5. DEPT-VAL-CREATE-005: Department create rejects invalid `managerId` format or non-existent user. Invalid example: `"507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"`.
6. DEPT-VAL-UPDATE-001: Update validates `name`, `description`, `status`, `managerId` with the same rules. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
7. DEPT-VAL-UPDATE-002: Update rejects invalid `departmentId` param or non-existent department. Invalid example: `"507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"`.
8. DEPT-VAL-LIST-001: `GET /api/departments` validates list params and rejects invalid `page`, `limit`, `sortOrder`, `includeDeleted`. Invalid example: `page=0, sortOrder="up"`.
9. DEPT-VAL-LIST-002: `GET /api/departments` validates filters `status`, `managerId`, `memberCountMin`, `memberCountMax`, `createdFrom`, `createdTo`. Invalid example: `status="INVALID"`.
10. DEPT-VAL-LIST-003: Platform SuperAdmin may pass `organizationId`; non-platform users passing `organizationId` receive 400 VALIDATION_ERROR. Invalid example: `organizationId="507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"`.
11. DEPT-VAL-ACTIVITY-001: `GET /api/departments/:departmentId/activity` validates `entityModel` enum and date range `from` and `to`. Invalid example: `from="2026-02-10", to="2026-02-01"`.
12. DEPT-VAL-RESTORE-001: `PATCH /api/departments/:departmentId/restore` uses `.withDeleted()` existence check. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.

**Department - Authorization**
1. DEPT-AUTHZ-CREATE-001: SuperAdmin can create departments in own organization.
2. DEPT-AUTHZ-CREATE-002: Admin, Manager, User cannot create departments.
3. DEPT-AUTHZ-READ-001: Platform SuperAdmin and Admin with `isPlatformOrgUser=true` can read departments across organizations.
4. DEPT-AUTHZ-READ-002: SuperAdmin and Admin can read departments in own organization.
5. DEPT-AUTHZ-READ-003: Manager and User can read only their own department.
6. DEPT-AUTHZ-READ-004: Manager and User are denied when accessing other departments in own org or cross-org.
7. DEPT-AUTHZ-UPDATE-001: SuperAdmin can update departments in own organization.
8. DEPT-AUTHZ-UPDATE-002: Admin can update only own department.
9. DEPT-AUTHZ-UPDATE-003: Manager and User cannot update departments.
10. DEPT-AUTHZ-UPDATE-004: Admin is denied when updating a different department in the same org.
11. DEPT-AUTHZ-UPDATE-005: SuperAdmin is denied when updating departments in other organizations.
12. DEPT-AUTHZ-DELETE-001: SuperAdmin can delete departments in own organization.
13. DEPT-AUTHZ-DELETE-002: Admin, Manager, User cannot delete departments.
14. DEPT-AUTHZ-DELETE-003: SuperAdmin is denied when deleting departments in other organizations.
15. DEPT-AUTHZ-RESTORE-001: Restore follows delete permissions and denies other roles.

**Department - Controller**
1. DEPT-CTRL-CREATE-001: Create derives `organization` from `req.user` and sets `createdBy` to current user.
2. DEPT-CTRL-UPDATE-001: Setting `status=INACTIVE` triggers enforcement for future create attempts (users/tasks/materials) with 409 CONFLICT_ERROR.
3. DEPT-CTRL-DELETE-001: Delete uses soft delete only and cascades to users, tasks, materials, activities, comments, attachments, notifications.
4. DEPT-CTRL-RESTORE-001: Restore uses `.withDeleted()` and restores cascaded resources in correct order.
5. DEPT-CTRL-ACTIVITY-001: Activity feed returns paginated items and respects `entityModel` and date filters.
6. DEPT-CTRL-GETLIST-001: `GET /api/departments` returns summary fields and aggregates (`memberCount`, `taskCount`, `activeTaskCount`).
7. DEPT-CTRL-GETONE-001: `GET /api/departments/:departmentId` returns core fields plus header aggregates (`totalUsers`, `totalTasks`, `activeTasks`).
8. DEPT-CTRL-LIST-001: `includeDeleted=true` includes soft-deleted departments in list responses.
9. DEPT-CTRL-TENANT-001: Cross-org access is denied even for valid department IDs.

## User

**User - Authentication**
1. USER-AUTH-GETLIST-001: `GET /api/users` without token returns 401.
2. USER-AUTH-POST-001: `POST /api/users` without token returns 401.
3. USER-AUTH-GETONE-001: `GET /api/users/:userId` without token returns 401.
4. USER-AUTH-GETACT-001: `GET /api/users/:userId/activity` without token returns 401.
5. USER-AUTH-GETPERF-001: `GET /api/users/:userId/performance` without token returns 401.
6. USER-AUTH-PUT-001: `PUT /api/users/:userId` without token returns 401.
7. USER-AUTH-PREF-001: `PUT /api/users/:userId/preferences` without token returns 401.
8. USER-AUTH-SEC-001: `PUT /api/users/:userId/security` without token returns 401.
9. USER-AUTH-DELETE-001: `DELETE /api/users/:userId` without token returns 401.
10. USER-AUTH-RESTORE-001: `PATCH /api/users/:userId/restore` without token returns 401.
11. USER-AUTH-GETONE-002: Expired token returns 401.
12. USER-AUTH-GETONE-003: `status=INACTIVE` user token returns 403.
13. USER-AUTH-GETONE-004: Cross-org token misuse returns 403 or 400.

**User - Validation**
1. USER-VAL-CREATE-001: `firstName` required, length 2-50, pattern `/^[a-zA-Z\s\-']+$/`. Invalid example: `"@@@"`.
2. USER-VAL-CREATE-002: `lastName` required, length 2-50, pattern `/^[a-zA-Z\s\-']+$/`. Invalid example: `"@@@"`.
3. USER-VAL-CREATE-003: `position` required, length 2-100, pattern `/^[a-zA-Z\s\-']+$/`. Invalid example: `"INVALID!"`.
4. USER-VAL-CREATE-004: `email` required, valid format, length <= 100, unique per organization. Invalid example: `""`.
5. USER-VAL-CREATE-005: `phone` optional, if present matches `^(\+251\d{9}|09\d{8})$`. Invalid example: `"12345"`.
6. USER-VAL-CREATE-006: `role` required, enum `SuperAdmin|Admin|Manager|User`. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
7. USER-VAL-CREATE-007: `departmentId` required, must exist in same organization. Invalid example: `"507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"`.
8. USER-VAL-CREATE-008: `isHod` optional boolean. Invalid example: `"yes"`.
9. USER-VAL-CREATE-009: `dateOfBirth` optional, must not be in the future. Invalid example: `"2999-01-01"`.
10. USER-VAL-CREATE-010: `joinedAt` required, must not be in the future. Invalid example: `"2999-01-01"`.
11. USER-VAL-CREATE-011: `employeeId` optional, must match `^(?!0000)\d{4}$` when provided. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
12. USER-VAL-CREATE-012: `skills` max 10 entries; each `skill` max 50; each `percentage` between 0 and 100. Invalid example: `"x" * 51`.
13. USER-VAL-CREATE-013: `profilePicture.url` optional, must match Cloudinary URL pattern. Invalid example: `"https://example.com/file.jpg"`.
14. USER-VAL-CREATE-014: `profilePicture.publicId` optional, max 255. Invalid example: `"x" * 256`.
15. USER-VAL-CREATE-015: Creation rejects if department is `INACTIVE` with 409 CONFLICT_ERROR. Invalid example: `status="INACTIVE"`.
16. USER-VAL-UPDATE-001: Update validates editable fields and rejects unknown fields. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
17. USER-VAL-UPDATE-002: Update enforces immutability for Admin/Manager/User targets on `departmentId`, `role`, `employeeId`, `joinedAt`, `isHod` with 409. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
18. USER-VAL-UPDATE-003: Update rejects invalid `status` enum or invalid `role` enum. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
19. USER-VAL-UPDATE-004: Update rejects duplicate email in same organization with 409. Invalid example: `"existing@example.com"`.
20. USER-VAL-PREF-001: Preferences update validates `themeMode`, `dateFormat`, `timeFormat`, `timezone` values. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
21. USER-VAL-SEC-001: Security update validates `twoFactorEnabled` boolean. Invalid example: `"yes"`.
22. USER-VAL-LIST-001: `GET /api/users` validates list params and filters `role`, `departmentId`, `status`, `joinedFrom`, `joinedTo`, `employeeId`, `includeInactive`. Invalid example: `page=0, sortOrder="up"`.
23. USER-VAL-LIST-002: Platform SuperAdmin may pass `organizationId`; non-platform users passing `organizationId` receive 400. Invalid example: `organizationId="507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"`.
24. USER-VAL-ACTIVITY-001: `GET /api/users/:userId/activity` validates `entityModel`, `from`, `to`. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
25. USER-VAL-PERF-001: `GET /api/users/:userId/performance` validates `range` enum. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
26. USER-VAL-DELETE-001: `DELETE /api/users/:userId` rejects invalid `userId` param or missing user. Invalid example: `null`.
27. USER-VAL-RESTORE-001: `PATCH /api/users/:userId/restore` uses `.withDeleted()` for existence checks. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.

**User - Authorization**
1. USER-AUTHZ-CREATE-001: SuperAdmin can create users in own organization.
2. USER-AUTHZ-CREATE-002: Admin, Manager, User cannot create users.
3. USER-AUTHZ-READ-001: Platform SuperAdmin with `isPlatformOrgUser=true` can read any user across orgs.
4. USER-AUTHZ-READ-002: SuperAdmin and Admin can read users in own organization.
5. USER-AUTHZ-READ-003: Manager and User can read users in own department only.
6. USER-AUTHZ-READ-004: Manager and User are denied when reading users outside their department or cross-org.
7. USER-AUTHZ-UPDATE-001: Any role can update their own user profile (ownership self).
8. USER-AUTHZ-UPDATE-002: SuperAdmin and Admin can update any user in own organization.
9. USER-AUTHZ-UPDATE-003: Manager and User cannot update other users.
10. USER-AUTHZ-UPDATE-004: Update is denied when ownership or scope checks fail.
11. USER-AUTHZ-UPDATE-005: Admin is denied when updating a user in a different organization.
12. USER-AUTHZ-UPDATE-006: Manager is denied when updating another user even within the same department.
13. USER-AUTHZ-PREF-001: Preferences update is self-only.
14. USER-AUTHZ-SEC-001: Security update is self-only.
15. USER-AUTHZ-DELETE-001: SuperAdmin can delete users in own organization.
16. USER-AUTHZ-DELETE-002: Admin, Manager, User cannot delete users.
17. USER-AUTHZ-DELETE-003: SuperAdmin is denied when deleting users in a different organization.
18. USER-AUTHZ-RESTORE-001: Restore follows delete permissions and denies other roles.

**User - Controller**
1. USER-CTRL-CREATE-001: Create sets `isVerified=true` for new users created by org SuperAdmin and sends welcome email with one-time setup link.
2. USER-CTRL-CREATE-002: Create auto-generates `employeeId` when omitted and enforces pattern.
3. USER-CTRL-CREATE-003: Create sets `joinedAt=now` when omitted.
4. USER-CTRL-CREATE-004: Create generates temporary password and stores hashed value only.
5. USER-CTRL-GETLIST-001: `GET /api/users` returns user summary fields with paginated response shape; includes `organization` only for Platform SuperAdmin.
6. USER-CTRL-GETONE-001: `GET /api/users/:userId` returns core profile fields plus `overviewAggregates`.
7. USER-CTRL-UPDATE-001: Update uses `req.validated` only and runs within a session for write.
8. USER-CTRL-UPDATE-002: Update enforces CAN-016 immutability with 409 on forbidden field changes for Admin/Manager/User targets.
9. USER-CTRL-UPDATE-003: Update changing `status=INACTIVE` prevents login and refresh for the user.

15. TASK-VAL-CREATE-015: RoutineTask `materials` must belong to same org and dept. Invalid example: `"507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"`.
16. TASK-VAL-CREATE-016: RoutineTask creation rejects if any material stock would go below 0. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
17. TASK-VAL-CREATE-017: Task create rejects when caller department is `INACTIVE` with 409. Invalid example: `status="INACTIVE"`.

3. TASK-AUTHZ-CREATE-003: All roles can create RoutineTask in own department.

5. TASK-AUTHZ-CREATE-005: User cannot create AssignedTask in any department.

7. TASK-AUTHZ-READ-002: All roles can read tasks in own department.
8. TASK-AUTHZ-READ-003: User can read tasks where they are assignee or watcher.
9. TASK-AUTHZ-READ-004: User is denied when not in own department and not an assignee or watcher.
10. TASK-AUTHZ-UPDATE-001: SuperAdmin/Admin can update ProjectTask they created in own department.
11. TASK-AUTHZ-UPDATE-002: All roles can update AssignedTask they created or are assigned to in own department.
12. TASK-AUTHZ-UPDATE-003: All roles can update RoutineTask they created in own department.
13. TASK-AUTHZ-UPDATE-004: User can update tasks they are assigned to in own department.
14. TASK-AUTHZ-UPDATE-005: Update is denied when ownership requirements are not met.
15. TASK-AUTHZ-UPDATE-006: Update is denied for cross-department scope mismatches.
16. TASK-AUTHZ-UPDATE-007: Admin is denied when updating a ProjectTask they did not create.
17. TASK-AUTHZ-UPDATE-008: Manager is denied when updating an AssignedTask they are neither assignee nor creator.
18. TASK-AUTHZ-UPDATE-009: User is denied when updating a RoutineTask they did not create.
19. TASK-AUTHZ-DELETE-001: SuperAdmin can delete tasks in own department.
20. TASK-AUTHZ-DELETE-002: Admin can delete ProjectTask they created in own department.
21. TASK-AUTHZ-DELETE-003: Admin can delete AssignedTask they created in own department.
22. TASK-AUTHZ-DELETE-004: Manager and User can delete AssignedTask they are assigned to in own department.
23. TASK-AUTHZ-DELETE-005: Admin, Manager, User can delete RoutineTask they created in own department.
24. TASK-AUTHZ-DELETE-006: Delete is denied when ownership or scope checks fail.
25. TASK-AUTHZ-DELETE-007: Admin is denied when deleting a ProjectTask they did not create.
26. TASK-AUTHZ-DELETE-008: Manager is denied when deleting an AssignedTask they are not assigned to.
27. TASK-AUTHZ-DELETE-009: User is denied when deleting a RoutineTask they did not create.
28. TASK-AUTHZ-RESTORE-001: Restore follows delete permissions and denies other roles.

**Task - Controller**
1. TASK-CTRL-CREATE-001: Create derives `organization` and `department` from `req.user` and sets `createdBy`.
2. TASK-CTRL-CREATE-002: Create adds creator to `watchers` by default.
3. TASK-CTRL-CREATE-003: Create for ProjectTask and AssignedTask creates initial TaskActivity "Task created".
4. TASK-CTRL-CREATE-004: Create for RoutineTask does not create TaskActivity.
5. TASK-CTRL-CREATE-005: Create emits socket events and creates notifications per real-time requirements.
6. TASK-CTRL-GETLIST-001: `GET /api/tasks` returns summary fields, derived counts, and paginated response shape.
7. TASK-CTRL-GETONE-001: `GET /api/tasks/:taskId` returns full task detail plus `overviewAggregates`.
8. TASK-CTRL-GETONE-002: Task detail includes attachments where `parentModel=Task` and is limited to max 20 items.
9. TASK-CTRL-UPDATE-001: Update of `status` or `priority` generates TaskActivity entries.
10. TASK-CTRL-UPDATE-002: RoutineTask materials update adjusts inventory by delta in the same session.
11. TASK-CTRL-UPDATE-003: RoutineTask materials update fails with 409 if inventory would go below 0 and performs no changes.
12. TASK-CTRL-DELETE-001: Delete is soft delete and cascades to activities, comments, attachments, notifications.
13. TASK-CTRL-DELETE-002: RoutineTask delete restores material stock by incrementing `inventory.stockOnHand` for used quantities.
14. TASK-CTRL-RESTORE-001: Restore uses `.withDeleted()` and re-applies material usage; fails if insufficient stock.
15. TASK-CTRL-RESTORE-002: Restore cascades in correct order and maintains parent-child integrity.

12. VEND-AUTHZ-DELETE-003: Delete is denied when requester is not the creator and lacks SuperAdmin role.
13. VEND-AUTHZ-DELETE-004: Admin and Manager are denied when deleting vendors they did not create.
14. VEND-AUTHZ-RESTORE-001: Restore follows delete permissions and denies other roles.

**Vendor - Controller**
1. VEND-CTRL-CREATE-001: Create derives organization from `req.user` and sets `createdBy`.
2. VEND-CTRL-GETLIST-001: `GET /api/vendors` returns summary fields and derived aggregates per vendor.
3. VEND-CTRL-GETONE-001: `GET /api/vendors/:vendorId` returns vendor core fields plus `metrics` object.
4. VEND-CTRL-UPDATE-001: Update enforces unique email and phone per organization.
5. VEND-CTRL-CONTACT-001: Contact sends email via Nodemailer and does not write a DB log.
6. VEND-CTRL-DELETE-001: Delete is blocked with 409 if vendor is associated with ProjectTasks (including soft-deleted).
7. VEND-CTRL-DELETE-002: Delete uses soft delete only.
8. VEND-CTRL-RESTORE-001: Restore uses `.withDeleted()` and restores soft-deleted vendor.

## Attachment

**Attachment - Authentication**
1. ATT-AUTH-POST-001: `POST /api/attachments` without token returns 401.
2. ATT-AUTH-DELETE-001: `DELETE /api/attachments/:attachmentId` without token returns 401.
3. ATT-AUTH-RESTORE-001: `PATCH /api/attachments/:attachmentId/restore` without token returns 401.
4. ATT-AUTH-POST-002: Expired token returns 401.
5. ATT-AUTH-POST-003: `status=INACTIVE` user token returns 403.
6. ATT-AUTH-POST-004: Cross-org token misuse returns 403 or 400.

**Attachment - Validation**
1. ATT-VAL-CREATE-001: `filename` required, length 1-255. Invalid example: `""`.
2. ATT-VAL-CREATE-002: `fileUrl` required, matches Cloudinary URL pattern and allowed resource type. Invalid example: `"https://example.com/file.jpg"`.
3. ATT-VAL-CREATE-003: `fileType` required, enum `Image|Video|Document|Audio|Other`. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
4. ATT-VAL-CREATE-004: `fileSize` required, min 0, max 10485760 (10MB). Invalid example: `10485761`.
5. ATT-VAL-CREATE-005: `parent` required and must exist. Invalid example: `"507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"`.
6. ATT-VAL-CREATE-006: `parentModel` required, enum `Task|TaskActivity|TaskComment|Material`. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
7. ATT-VAL-CREATE-007: Parent must belong to same organization and department (Material is department-scoped). Invalid example: `"507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"`.
8. ATT-VAL-CREATE-008: Reject file extensions not in allowlist. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
9. ATT-VAL-DELETE-001: Delete rejects invalid `attachmentId` or non-existent attachment. Invalid example: `"507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"`.
10. ATT-VAL-RESTORE-001: Restore uses `.withDeleted()` existence checks. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.

**Attachment - Authorization**
1. ATT-AUTHZ-CREATE-001: All roles can create attachments in own department.
2. ATT-AUTHZ-READ-001: Platform SuperAdmin can read any attachment across orgs.
3. ATT-AUTHZ-READ-002: All roles can read attachments in own department.
4. ATT-AUTHZ-READ-003: Access is denied when attachment belongs to a different organization or department.
5. ATT-AUTHZ-DELETE-001: SuperAdmin can delete attachments in own department.
6. ATT-AUTHZ-DELETE-002: Admin, Manager, User can delete attachments they uploaded in own department.
7. ATT-AUTHZ-DELETE-003: Delete is denied when requester is not uploader and lacks SuperAdmin role.
8. ATT-AUTHZ-RESTORE-001: Restore follows delete permissions and denies other roles.

**Attachment - Controller**
1. ATT-CTRL-CREATE-001: Create runs in session, links to parent, and enforces parent scoping.
2. ATT-CTRL-CREATE-002: Create emits socket events and creates notifications where applicable.
3. ATT-CTRL-CREATE-003: Create returns attachment summary payload with `filename`, `fileUrl`, `fileType`, and parent reference.
4. ATT-CTRL-DELETE-001: Delete uses soft delete only and validates association via parent lookup.
5. ATT-CTRL-DELETE-002: Delete returns success and sets `isDeleted`, `deletedAt`, `deletedBy`.
6. ATT-CTRL-RESTORE-001: Restore uses `.withDeleted()` and ensures parent exists before restoring.
7. ATT-CTRL-RESTORE-002: Restore clears delete flags and returns updated attachment summary.

## Notification

**Notification - Authentication**
1. NOTIF-AUTH-GETLIST-001: `GET /api/notifications` without token returns 401.
2. NOTIF-AUTH-READ-001: `PATCH /api/notifications/:notificationId/read` without token returns 401.
3. NOTIF-AUTH-READALL-001: `PATCH /api/notifications/mark-all-read` without token returns 401.
4. NOTIF-AUTH-DELETE-001: `DELETE /api/notifications/:notificationId` without token returns 401.
5. NOTIF-AUTH-GETLIST-002: Expired token returns 401.
6. NOTIF-AUTH-GETLIST-003: `status=INACTIVE` user token returns 403.
7. NOTIF-AUTH-GETLIST-004: Cross-org token misuse returns 403 or 400.

**Notification - Validation**
1. NOTIF-VAL-LIST-001: List validates `isRead` boolean, `entityModel` enum, and date range `from`/`to`. Invalid example: `from="2026-02-10", to="2026-02-01"`.
2. NOTIF-VAL-READ-001: `notificationId` must exist and belong to the caller org and dept. Invalid example: `"507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"`.
3. NOTIF-VAL-DELETE-001: Delete rejects invalid `notificationId` or non-existent notification. Invalid example: `"507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"`.
4. NOTIF-VAL-RESTORE-001: If restore is supported, use `.withDeleted()` existence checks. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.

**Notification - Authorization**
1. NOTIF-AUTHZ-READ-001: All roles can read notifications in own department.
2. NOTIF-AUTHZ-UPDATE-001: All roles can update notifications (mark read) in own department.
3. NOTIF-AUTHZ-DELETE-001: SuperAdmin can delete notifications in own department.
4. NOTIF-AUTHZ-DENY-001: Access is denied when notification belongs to a different org or department.
5. NOTIF-AUTHZ-DENY-002: Non-SuperAdmin is denied when attempting to delete notifications.

**Notification - Controller**
1. NOTIF-CTRL-LIST-001: List returns only notifications for caller org and dept.
2. NOTIF-CTRL-LIST-002: List uses paginated response shape and includes `entity` and `entityModel` fields when present.
3. NOTIF-CTRL-READ-001: Mark read updates `isRead=true` for a single notification.
4. NOTIF-CTRL-READALL-001: Mark all read updates only current-user notifications.
5. NOTIF-CTRL-READALL-002: Mark all read returns success and count of notifications updated.
6. NOTIF-CTRL-DELETE-001: Delete is soft delete only and preserves audit history.
7. NOTIF-CTRL-TTL-001: Notifications expire after 30 days via TTL settings.

## Organization CRUD (If Implemented)

**Organization CRUD - Authentication**
1. ORGCRUD-AUTH-GETLIST-001: `GET /api/organizations` without token returns 401.
2. ORGCRUD-AUTH-GETONE-001: `GET /api/organizations/:organizationId` without token returns 401.
3. ORGCRUD-AUTH-PUT-001: `PUT /api/organizations/:organizationId` without token returns 401.
4. ORGCRUD-AUTH-DELETE-001: `DELETE /api/organizations/:organizationId` without token returns 401.

**Organization CRUD - Validation**
1. ORGCRUD-VAL-LIST-001: List validates standard list params and rejects invalid `organizationId` filter when not platform user. Invalid example: `page=0, sortOrder="up"`.
2. ORGCRUD-VAL-UPDATE-001: Update validates fields as in Organization Validation section and rejects invalid `organizationId`. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.

**Organization CRUD - Authorization**
1. ORGCRUD-AUTHZ-READ-001: Platform SuperAdmin with `isPlatformOrgUser=true` can read any organization.
2. ORGCRUD-AUTHZ-READ-002: All roles can read own organization.
3. ORGCRUD-AUTHZ-UPDATE-001: Platform SuperAdmin can update cross-org organizations.
4. ORGCRUD-AUTHZ-UPDATE-002: Non-platform SuperAdmin can update own organization.
5. ORGCRUD-AUTHZ-DELETE-001: Platform SuperAdmin can delete cross-org organizations, but platform org cannot be deleted.

**Organization CRUD - Controller**
1. ORGCRUD-CTRL-DELETE-001: Delete uses soft delete only and cascades to child resources.
2. ORGCRUD-CTRL-DELETE-002: Platform organization delete attempt is blocked.

## Dashboard (Analytics)

**Dashboard - Authentication**
1. DASH-AUTH-OVERVIEW-001: `GET /api/dashboard/overview` without token returns 401.
2. DASH-AUTH-DEPT-001: `GET /api/departments/:departmentId/dashboard` without token returns 401.
3. DASH-AUTH-OVERVIEW-002: Expired token returns 401.
4. DASH-AUTH-OVERVIEW-003: `status=INACTIVE` user token returns 403.
5. DASH-AUTH-OVERVIEW-004: Cross-org token misuse returns 403 or 400.

**Dashboard - Validation**
1. DASH-VAL-OVERVIEW-001: Validate date range query params `from` and `to` if provided and ensure `from <= to`. Invalid example: `from="2026-02-10", to="2026-02-01"`.
2. DASH-VAL-OVERVIEW-002: Optional `departmentId` (if supported) must belong to caller org and be permitted by role. Invalid example: `"507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"`.
3. DASH-VAL-DEPT-001: `departmentId` param must exist and belong to caller org. Invalid example: `"507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"`.
4. DASH-VAL-OVERVIEW-003: Platform SuperAdmin may pass `organizationId` if supported; non-platform users passing `organizationId` receive 400. Invalid example: `organizationId="507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"`.

**Dashboard - Authorization**
1. DASH-AUTHZ-OVERVIEW-001: Platform SuperAdmin can access overview for any org scope when permitted.
2. DASH-AUTHZ-OVERVIEW-002: Customer org roles can access only own org overview.
3. DASH-AUTHZ-DEPT-001: SuperAdmin and Admin can access any department dashboard in own org.
4. DASH-AUTHZ-DEPT-002: Manager and User can access only own department dashboard.

**Dashboard - Controller**
1. DASH-CTRL-OVERVIEW-001: Overview returns required KPIs and chart-ready series with ISO 8601 UTC timestamps.
2. DASH-CTRL-DEPT-001: Department dashboard returns required KPI fields and lists with correct scoping.
3. DASH-CTRL-EMPTY-001: Dashboard endpoints handle empty data sets without errors.

## Socket Events (Real-Time)

**Socket - Controller**
1. SOCK-CTRL-001: `task:created` emitted to task, dept, org, and watcher/assignee user rooms as applicable.
2. SOCK-CTRL-002: `task:updated` emitted to task, dept, org, and watcher/assignee user rooms as applicable.
3. SOCK-CTRL-003: `task:deleted` emitted to task, dept, org, and watcher/assignee user rooms as applicable.
4. SOCK-CTRL-004: `task:activity:added` emitted to task and dept rooms and actor user room.
5. SOCK-CTRL-005: `task:comment:added` emitted to task and dept rooms and mentioned user rooms.
6. SOCK-CTRL-006: `notification` emitted to `user:{userId}` room for each notification recipient.
7. SOCK-CTRL-007: `user:status:changed` emitted when user online/offline status changes.

## Cross-Cutting Validation and Controller Rules

**Cross-Cutting - Validation**
1. CROSS-VAL-001: All list endpoints accept `page`, `limit`, `sortBy`, `sortOrder`, `search`, `includeDeleted` and reject invalid types. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
2. CROSS-VAL-002: Multi-select query params use comma-separated values and reject repeated keys. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
3. CROSS-VAL-003: Validators for create and restore use `.withDeleted()` existence checks. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
4. CROSS-VAL-004: Department and vendor validators are scoped by `req.user.organization._id`. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.
5. CROSS-VAL-005: User, task, activity, comment, attachment, notification validators are scoped by `req.user.organization._id` and `req.user.department._id`. Invalid example: `"INVALID"`.

**Cross-Cutting - Controller**
1. CROSS-CTRL-001: All write controllers use MongoDB sessions with `commitTransaction` and `abortTransaction` and `endSession` in finally.
2. CROSS-CTRL-002: Controllers use `req.validated.body`, `req.validated.params`, and `req.validated.query` only.
3. CROSS-CTRL-003: Soft delete methods are used instead of hard deletes; restore uses plugin methods.
4. CROSS-CTRL-004: Non-platform users cannot access other organizations under any circumstances.
5. CROSS-CTRL-005: All API responses use ISO 8601 UTC strings.
